name: cashprizes
text: I'm patiently waiting for a chance to use that line.

name: jamers
text: Gonna be a while, but it'll be well worth it.

name: joeyramoney
text: someone please explain it to me.

name: spinynorman
text:
The skinny cat is providing a hangover cure for the fat the fat, drunk, and maybe legally dead cat.

Also, balm in Gilead is a line used in several famous places I can't think of at the moment. Balm is basically just a cure or a curative, Gilead I believe was a territory during the crusades. Maybe the Bible. It's healing in a bad place, basically.

name: apocowarg
text:
%u201CGo up to Gilead and take balm.%u201D Jeremiah 46:11

There is a balm in Gilead
To make the wounded whole;
There is a balm in Gilead
To heal the sin sick soul.

name: terriblerobot
text:
I always imagined that Roast Beef was answering the question posed by the protagonist to the bird in the poem The Raven.
"Is there - is there balm in Gilead? - tell me - tell me, I implore!'
Quoth the raven, `Nevermore.'"

I have no idea why my brain made that connection.

name: woodenteeth
text: You made the connection correctly, the guy in the Raven is quoting the bible, as is Beef... or Beef is quoting the Raven. Either way how can you but not focus on anything beside the ghastly, white phantasma of the teeth !

name: catgrl131
text: Woah, no need to call him fat twice!

name: fuzzyshoo
text: they're both in hell, aren't they both legally dead?

name: kavingi
text: Shit, here I was thinking, Gunslinger reference.

name: lizjones
text: hints of Ray's buttcrack

name: ceokasen
text: Wait - Why is there buttcrack above his tail?

name: cpnglxynchos
text: he is wearing a thong, after all.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: no he is not, he is wearing more of a speedo type device, were it a thong we would get hella visage of Ray Ass

name: connormc
text: no dude i'm pretty sure a multitude of alt texts etc. use the word 'thong' as opposed to 'speedo type device'

name: connormc
text: man you know what?  i'm sorry i lamed you.  you made a simple mistake and that just does not merit a lame.  it just does not.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: Well I know they use the word thong and it is called a thong, but if it looks like a pear and a man calls it and apple, does that make it an apple? Basically what I am saying is they call it a thong and yet while it resembles one it is not really such a thing. Were it a real thong this although a little less fat and with a tail is what we would be getting.

name: mugi
text:
I've noticed that, too. I guess "thong" is just a funnier-sounding word.
Also, ew.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: So Ray seems like a drunk guy in the gutter, which he is pretty much kinda

name: epicurus
text: Did beef have that in advance, or did he go back and get it, secure in the knowledge that Ray wasn't going anywhere?

name: gompo
text: Beef and Ray have known each other since childhood.  I'm sure it was the first thing he picked up when he started looking.

name: tombsgrave
text: "There is balm in Gilead" is more epic than any coax-someone-out-of-drunken-vomit line should be.

name: quantumcasaba
text:
Quite a bit kinder than
"Come on now
Who's the idiot
Who is daddy's idiot"

name: c_dizzle
text: "RAY! YOU WERE A FAT CHILD! YOU...WERE...A...FAT...CHILD!!!"

name: djwhiterabbit
text: the black and white characters against the color backdrop was a great stylistic choice.  the subtle impact wouldn't have been the same had the cats been colored. they are strangers in this place.

name: mega_panda
text: My thongs also have tail holes

name: killerlimpet
text: FURRY

name: tekende
text: You're wearing them the wrong way around then.

name: rogergs
text: Yea, verily.

name: rosie
text:
Beef is probably referring to the church hymn when he offers Ray the balm for his hangover. The song "There Is Balm In Gilead" is a traditional African-American spiritual.
There is a balm in Gilead
To make the wounded whole;
There is a balm in Gilead
To heal the sin sick soul.
(this is just the refrain for the song, there's more to it than this).

name: endoftheworld
text: "Is There Balm in Gilead?" is also a question asked of The Raven in Poe's famous poem of the same name. For the speaker in that poem who'd lost the love of his life, there was none. But for Ray, even in Hell's darkest economy motels, there is some because his oldest friend is watching out for him.

name: tombsgrave
text: Not enough chubbies to give you, I have, not enough chubbies to give.

name: wittyname
text: Man I was going to make the same comment, but you beat me too it by 3 months.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Quoth the Raven- Chubbies, more!

name: i_love_kate
text: The return of the buttcrack which rises even above Ray's tail.

name: charchar
text: 7-11's coffee is hell on earth.  For infinite reals.

name: lawbot
text: It comes from vending machine.

name: lawbot
text: Also, why is 7-11 an iconic american brand I see in all films? I have only ever seen one in the US, in Boston.

name: goddessdictator
text: every fifty feet in los angeles. i have mentioned this before. srsly every fifty feet. i love 7-eleven. <3

name: cpnglxynchos
text: TEAM GULPS OF SLURPEES

name: lawbot
text: Has anyone tried this cure? I would like to know how efficacious it is.

name: canusdivinus
text: I just realized. Ray and Beef are not white cats, so their whiteness is painfully out of place. Is it that Hell reduces its inhabitants to gray scale?

name: catgrl131
text: Not really, because Robert Johnson was shown in full color.

name: wurlitzergirl
text: I always thought it was raw egg and Worcestershire sauce?

name: cpnglxynchos
text: surreal as the cartoon heli-walker going through all the fields and such.

name: soticoto
text:
Dude...
Makes me wish I had a friend like Beef... all ready to kill himself to go to hell and find me drunk and collapsed all ready with a hangover cure.
That is dedication right there.
Shame not all folks from circumstances turn out that decent. I'd be the classic example myself of how they don't.
